steps.title: Landing on Invoify
details: Every scenario starts by opening https://invoify.vercel.app and loading succeeds.

steps.title: Expecting Step-1 (Bill From / Bill To)
details: Both dedicated tests time-out looking for headings ‘Bill From :’ and ‘Bill To :’.
User never sees the first form screen and therefore cannot proceed with invoice creation.

steps.title: Template system – page chrome
details: Landing-page header “BETA English Toggle theme” is not found, blocking all later template actions (select Template 1, Template 2, logo upload).

steps.title: Logo upload journey
details: User cannot locate logo-upload entry point; test aborts immediately after opening the app.

steps.title: Live preview – basic entry
details: User is able to fill all ‘Bill From’ and ‘Bill To’ fields and sees data appear in preview (passes).
When editing data afterward, at least one field (Zip) fails to update in preview – user loses trust (hard fail).

steps.title: Wizard / preview synchronization
details: Wizard step button ‘1 . From & To’ is not clickable (timeout); user stuck on step navigation.

steps.title: Visual review issues captured automatically
details: Frequent ‘looks off’ flags: inconsistent button styles, mis-aligned labels, uneven padding, placeholder copy not informative, missing logo option visibility.

emotional_arc: Hopeful on first load → Confused when the expected first form (Bill From / Bill To) never appears → Growing frustration as multiple key UI elements (header, template selector, logo upload) cannot be located → Brief relief when live preview shows initial data → Trust shaken when edits do not propagate → Overall sense of unreliability and polish issues by the end of the session.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Initial wizard screen visibility (Bill From / Bill To)
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users abandon quickly if they can’t find the first required fields; core task blocked.
next_actions: Ensure Step 1 renders immediately on page load.
Add loading skeleton or progress indicator until the wizard mounts.
Audit heading text—remove trailing spaces/colons that break locators and may impair accessibility.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Missing header prevents access to language switch, theme toggle, and signals that page failed partially.
next_actions: Defer non-critical scripts so core UI paints first.
Use robust CSS that doesn’t collapse header in low-width viewports.
Log front-end errors and surface fallback UI if header fails to mount.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Customization is a selling point; users must immediately see where to change template or upload logo.
next_actions: Place template selector and logo upload in consistently sized, labeled card near preview.
Add ‘Upload logo’ button with universal icon and help tooltip.
Persist selections in local storage to reinforce success.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Real-time feedback builds trust; any lag or miss undermines perceived quality.
next_actions: Debounce form-to-preview binding less aggressively or diff-test every field.
Write unit tests for each field → preview mapping (e.g., Zip).
Show small spinner in preview while data is syncing.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Uneven spacing and misaligned labels make product feel unfinished and hamper readability.
next_actions: Adopt design tokens for spacing (8-pt grid).
Run CSS linter / visual regression tests on every commit.
Standardize button component variants (primary, secondary) and enforce in Storybook.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Generic placeholders (‘Placeholder text is not informative’) do not instruct users, hurting form completion rates.
next_actions: Replace placeholders with examples (e.g., ‘Acme Corp.’, ‘123 Main St.’).
Keep placeholder text lighter color but accessible contrast.

first_tackles.description: Guarantee Step 1 (‘Bill From’ & ‘Bill To’ sections) is visible instantly on load; add fallback message if data fails to render.
Fix two-way binding bugs so every edited field updates live preview in <200 ms.
Standardize spacing, label alignment, and button styles via a single design-system stylesheet.
Add explicit ‘Template’ selector and ‘Upload logo’ button next to live preview to improve discoverability.
Replace generic placeholder copy with concrete, helpful examples to speed form completion.
